intro: Hieracium amblylobum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, often in rocky or grassy areas. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, with hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. Its botanical features include a robust root system and a distinctive morphology adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and wind-pollinated flowers.
